intro: Sida madagascariensis, commonly known as Madagascar thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
